creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: domed top carved with 2 dragons with gilded details among waves; Ming-style imperial seal on bottom; sides carved with organic designs
inscription:
Inscription

on seal, on bottom: [Eternal collection of the heavenly palace]
text: This ink cake, molded in the form of a large official seal, is decorated on its face with a pair of dragons cavorting among the waves. The reverse side, shown here, displays a Ming-style imperial seal-script legend in four large characters, tianfu yongcang (天府永藏), meaning “eternal collection of the heavenly palace.” This cake conforms in shape and design to ink cakes made by the mid-eighteenth-century ink maker Wang Weigao.
title: Ink stick in seal form
